intro: Ferulago biumbellata, commonly known as the two-branched ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Ferulago biumbellata is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
